name: CWE-624: Avoid preg_replace with /e option (PHP)
description: This rule detects call to preg_replace with /e option or raw user input as pattern to replace.
output:
This report lists all artifacts that uses call to preg_replace with /e option or user input as pattern to replace.
This QR provides the following information:
Artifact Full Name
rationale: Using preg_replace with /e option or raw user input can expose code to remote code execution.
remediationSample:
<?php

function replace_callback() {
   return 'toreplace';
}

echo preg_replace_callback("/.*/i", replace_callback, 'input');

?>

qualityStandards.name: Executable Regular Expression Error
qualityStandards.description: The product uses a regular expression that either (1) contains an executable component with user-controlled inputs, or (2) allows a user to enable execution by inserting pattern modifiers.
